{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328259,"name":"","username":"GearFox","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gearfox/{size}/191322_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T00:46:35.017Z","cooked":"

Hey CD,

We’ve been using the Playing with Fusion CAN ToF sensor recently on our robot, and have been noticing a massive CPU usage spike since we added it to our bot. Without the sensor, we average around %55 usage, since adding the sensor it’s spiked up to %85. I’ve sent an email to PWF, who say that they’ve only recently heard of this issue, and are looking for a fix. Are there any other teams that have noticed this issue as well, and if so what have you been doing so far to fix it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T00:46:35.017Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":32,"reads":308,"readers_count":307,"score":221.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457975,"topic_slug":"pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51536,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage/457975/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3328325,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T02:59:42.665Z","cooked":"

We’ve got two running in our robot, and have been having loop overrun issues. I haven’t profiled it yet(tomorrow) but I’m starting to suspect it’s the pwf TOF sensors as our robot is generally pretty simple code wise.

We had this issue at week zero and found simply instantiating a TOF sensor would jump us to 100% CPU usage.

We swapped to LaserCAN instead.

It’s probably the configuration webserver that runs on the rio that causes most of the cpu usage.

AFAIK that configuration webserver was removed in their latest release, because it crashes with WPILib 2024.2.1 and newer.

Huh, I must’ve misunderstood the vendor’s memo. I’ll see myself out then…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T13:46:22.642Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457975,"topic_slug":"pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage","display_username":"Davo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-playingwithfusion/issues/12#issuecomment-1913900285","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"[BUG]: visiting Playing with Fusion web interface crashes code without stack trace. · Issue #12 · robotpy/robotpy-playingwithfusion · GitHub","clicks":15}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":23008,"username":"ErikSLee","name":"ErikSLee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erikslee/{size}/157434_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI"},"post_url":"/t/pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage/457975/9","custom_user_title":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3328604,"name":"Jared Leonard","username":"JaredL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T19:04:47.255Z","cooked":"

We’ve (Playing With Fusion) received a large number of reports, both through CD and through email about libPlayingWithFusion eating a significant chunk of CPU. We wouldn’t expect a high of a CPU hit as what people are experiencing and we are trying to investigate further.

Just be be clear, 2024.01.28 is the most recent version of libPlayingWithFusion. It was released to work with WPILib 2024.2.1. We did not intentionally remove the webserver earlier this year. There was a breaking change introduced by WPILib 2024.2.1 - which is why we released libPlayingWithFusion 2024.01.28

We’ll reply to this thread once we know more.

@JaredL We are having an issue with updating firmware of new sensors. We have 1 existing one on our robot, but when we add a new one, and try to update the firmware everything just hangs. Not sure if it is related or not, but it is leaving us without working sensors.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T20:07:36.462Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457975,"topic_slug":"pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage","display_username":"ErikSLee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Milwaukee Robotics Academy, 2830, 8802, 9425, 9760, 10287 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage/457975/11","custom_user_title":"Milwaukee Robotics Academy, 2830, 8802, 9425, 9760, 10287 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3328881,"name":"Jared Leonard","username":"JaredL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T05:08:18.772Z","cooked":"

We determined root cause and have released version 2024.03.09 of libPlayingWithFusion to resolve the the excessive CPU usage folks have been seeing. Please update the the latest library as well as WPILib 2024.3.1 and let me know if any of you are still seeing high CPU load.

Not related to this issue, but while I’m here, we discovered another issue when updating firmware on the 2024 TOF sensors. It’s possible to brick these sensors when reprogramming using the PWF roboRio web interface on port 5812. Older sensors (last 2 years) are not affected.

If you bought a TOF sensor this year, do not attempt to update the firmware. libPlayingWithFusion 2024.03.09 also contains a patch to prevent loading bad firmware on the affected units.

If you attempted to update the firmware on a TOF sensor and can no longer communicate with it, PM me or email us at TechnicalSupport@playingWithFusion.com.

@ErikSLee I replied to your email earlier tonight.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2024-03-10T05:08:18.772Z","reply_count":5,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":338.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457975,"topic_slug":"pwf-time-of-flight-sensor-cpu-usage","display_username":"Jared Leonard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42432,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Playing With Fusion, Inc.
